Infer the date from context.

Q: Today is Christmas Eve of 1937. What is the date 10 days ago in MM/DD/YYYY?
Options:
(A) 12/14/2026
(B) 12/14/1950
(C) 12/14/2007
(D) 12/14/1937
(E) 07/14/1938
(F) 12/14/1988
A: (D)

Q: Tomorrow is 11/12/2019. What is the date one year ago from today in MM/DD/YYYY?
Options:
(A) 09/04/2018
(B) 11/11/2018
(C) 08/25/2018
(D) 11/02/2018
(E) 11/04/2018
A: (B)

Q: Jane and John married on Jan 2, 1958. It is their 5-year anniversary today. What is the date tomorrow in MM/DD/YYYY?
Options:
(A) 01/11/1961
(B) 01/03/1963
(C) 01/18/1961
(D) 10/14/1960
(E) 01/03/1982
(F) 12/03/1960
A: (B)

Q: The day before yesterday was 11/23/1933. What is the date one week from today in MM/DD/YYYY?

(A) 11/25/1933
(B) 12/02/1974
(C) 12/16/1933
(D) 11/11/1933
(E) 12/23/1933
(F) 12/02/1933

Q: The target grid has a pattern where the first and last rows are identical, and the second and fourth rows are identical. The third row is the only one that is different, with a blank cell in the fourth column. In the second and fourth rows, the first three cells are filled with Xs, and the fourth cell is blank. In the first and last rows, the first four cells are filled with Xs, and the fifth cell is blank. In the third row, the first four cells are filled with Xs, and the fifth cell is blank.
Answer: third||
